Basic Inputs

perm_data_settingchat_bubble_outline
HomeForm ComponetsBasic Inputs

Basic Text Inputs

Forms are the standard way to receive user inputted data. The transitions and smoothness of these elements are very important because of the inherent user interaction associated with forms.

Basic Form Input

Text fields allow user input. The border should light up simply and clearly indicating which field the user is currently editing. You must have a .input-field div wrapping your input and label. This helps our jQuery animate the label. This is only used in our Input and Textarea form elements.

The validate class leverages HTML5 validation and will add a valid and invalid class accordingly. If you don't want the Green and Red validation states, just remove the validate class from your inputs.

This is an inline input field: 

<div class="row">
	<div class="input-field col s6">
		<input type="text" id="first_name" placeholder="First Name" class="validate">
		<label for="first_name" class="active">First Name</label>
	</div>
	<div class="input-field col s6">
		<input type="text" id="last_name" placeholder="Last Name" class="validate">
		<label for="last_name" class="active">Last Name</label>
	</div>
</div>
<div class="row">
	<div class="input-field col s12">
		<input type="text" id="disabled" placeholder="I am disabled!" disabled="" class="validate">
		<label for="disabled" class="active">Disabled</label>
	</div>
</div>
<div class="row">
	<div class="input-field col s12">
		<input type="email" id="email" placeholder="Email" class="validate">
		<label for="email" class="active">Email</label>
	</div>
</div>
<div class="row">
	<div class="input-field col s12">
		<input type="password" id="password" placeholder="Password" class="validate">
		<label for="password" class="active">Password</label>
	</div>
</div>
<div class="row">
	<div class="input-field col s12">
		<input type="text" id="readonly" value="I am readonlt!" readonly="">
		<label for="readonly" class="active">Readonly</label>
	</div>
</div>
<div class="row">
	<div class="input-field col s12">
		<input type="text" id="predefined" value="http://">
		<label for="predefined" class="active">Predefine value</label>
	</div>
</div>
<div class="row">
	<div class="input-field col s12">
		<input type="text" id="maxvalue" maxlength="4" placeholder="Max charater 4">
		<label for="maxvalue" class="active">Maximum value</label>
	</div>
</div>
<div class="row">
	<div class="input-field col s12">
		<input type="text" id="static-text" value="This is static text." readonly="" class="static-text">
		<label for="static-text" class="active">Static-text</label>
	</div>
</div>
<div class="row">
	<div class="input-field col s12">
		<textarea name="textarea" id="textarea-form" placeholder="Write here something" class="materialize-textarea"></textarea>
		<label for="textarea-form" class="active">Textarea</label>
	</div>
</div>
<div class="row">
	<div class="col s12">This is an inline input field:
		<div class="input-field inline">
			<input id="email" type="email" class="validate">
			<label for="email" data-error="wrong" data-success="right">Email</label>
		</div>
	</div>
</div>
Prefilling Text Inputs

If you are having trouble with the labels overlapping prefilled content, Try adding class="active" to the label.

You can also call the function Materialize.updateTextFields(); to reinitialize all the Materialize labels on the page if you are dynamically adding inputs.


	<div class="row">
		<div class="input-field col s6">
			<input value="Alvin" id="first_name2" type="text" class="validate">
			<label class="active" for="first_name2">First Name</label>
		</div>
	</div>
Icon Prefixes

You can add an icon prefix to make the form input label even more clear. Just add an icon with the class prefix before the input and label.

account_circle
phone 

	<div class="row">
		<form class="col s12">
			<div class="row">
				<div class="input-field col s6">
					<i class="material-icons prefix">account_circle</i>
					<input id="icon_prefix" type="text" class="validate">
					<label for="icon_prefix">First Name</label>
				</div>
				<div class="input-field col s6">
					<i class="material-icons prefix">phone</i>
					<input id="icon_telephone" type="tel" class="validate">
					<label for="icon_telephone">Telephone</label>
				</div>
			</div>
		</form>
	</div>
Custom Error or Success Messages

You can add custom validation messages by adding either data-error or data-success attributes to your input field labels.


	<div class="row">
		<form class="col s12">
			<div class="row">
				<div class="input-field col s12">
					<input id="email" type="email" class="validate">
					<label for="email" data-error="wrong" data-success="right">Email</label>
				</div>
			</div>
		</form>
	</div>
Changing Colors

Here is a CSS template for modifying input fields in CSS. With Sass, you can achieve this by just changing a variable. The CSS shown below is unprefixed. Depending on what you use, you may have to change the type attribute selector.


	/* label color */
		.input-field label {
			color: #000;
		}
		/* label focus color */
		.input-field input[type=text]:focus + label {
			color: #000;
		}
		/* label underline focus color */
		.input-field input[type=text]:focus {
			border-bottom: 1px solid #000;
			box-shadow: 0 1px 0 0 #000;
		}
		/* valid color */
		.input-field input[type=text].valid {
			border-bottom: 1px solid #000;
			box-shadow: 0 1px 0 0 #000;
		}
		/* invalid color */
		.input-field input[type=text].invalid {
			border-bottom: 1px solid #000;
			box-shadow: 0 1px 0 0 #000;
		}
		/* icon prefix focus color */
		.input-field .prefix.active {
			color: #000;
		}

Textarea

Textareas allow larger expandable user input. The border should light up simply and clearly indicating which field the user is currently editing.

Materialize Textarea

You must have a .input-field div wrapping your input and label. This helps our jQuery animate the label. This is only used in our Input and Textarea form elements.

Textareas will auto resize to the text inside. 

	<div class="row">
		<form class="col s12">
			<div class="row">
				<div class="input-field col s12">
					<textarea id="textarea1" class="materialize-textarea"></textarea>
					<label for="textarea1">Textarea</label>
				</div>
			</div>
		</form>
	</div>

Advanced note: When dynamically changing the value of a textarea with methods like jQuery's .val(), you must trigger an autoresize on it afterwords because .val() does not automatically trigger the events we've binded to the textarea.


	$('#textarea1').val('New Text');
	$('#textarea1').trigger('autoresize');

Select

Select allows user input through specified options. Make sure you wrap it in a .input-field for proper alignment with other text fields. Initialization line is as follow.


	$(document).ready(function() {
		$('select').material_select();
	});
Basic Selects

This is the simple example of Material select box.


<select name="selecter" id="single-select1" class="basic-select">
	<option value="" disabled="disabled" selected="selected">Choose your option</option>
	<option value="1">Option 1</option>
	<option value="2">Option 2</option>
	<option value="3">Option 3</option>
	<option value="4">Option 4</option>
</select>
<label for="single-select1">Single Select</label>
Multiple Select

You can add the property multiple to get the multiple select and select several options.


<select name="selecter" id="multiple-select1" multiple="multiple" class="basic-select">
	<option value="" disabled="disabled" selected="selected">Choose your option</option>
	<option value="1">Option 1</option>
	<option value="2">Option 2</option>
	<option value="3">Option 3</option>
	<option value="4">Option 4</option>
</select>
<label for="multiple-select1">Multiple Select</label>
Option Group Select

With one more option with single select,we have optgroups in our selects.


<select  class="basic-select">
	<optgroup label="team 1">
		<option value="1">Option 1</option>
		<option value="2">Option 2</option>
	</optgroup>
	<optgroup label="team 2">
		<option value="3">Option 3</option>
		<option value="4">Option 4</option>
	</optgroup>
</select>
<label>Optgroups</label>
Iconized Option Select

You can add icons to your options in any type of select. In the option you add the image source with the data-icon attribute. You can add the left or right class to align your icon. You can also add the circle class to your icon.


<div class="row">
	<div class="input-field col s12 m6">
		<select class="icons basic-select">
			<option value="" disabled="" selected="">Choose your option</option>
			<option value="" data-icon="https://placeimg.com/300/300/people" class="circle">example 1</option>
			<option value="" data-icon="https://placeimg.com/300/300/people" class="circle">example 2</option>
			<option value="" data-icon="https://placeimg.com/300/300/people" class="circle">example 1</option>
		</select>
		<label>Images in select</label>
	</div>
	<div class="input-field col s12 m6">
		<select class="icons basic-select">
			<option value="" disabled="" selected="">Choose your option</option>
			<option value="" data-icon="https://placeimg.com/300/300/people" class="left circle">example 1</option>
			<option value="" data-icon="https://placeimg.com/300/300/people" class="left circle">example 2</option>
			<option value="" data-icon="https://placeimg.com/300/300/people" class="left circle">example 1</option>
		</select>
		<label>Images in select</label>
	</div>
</div>
Browser Default

If you don't want to use material select the you use browser default select box by setting class .browser-default.

Browser Default


<select class="browser-default">
	<option value="" disabled="" selected=""> Browser Select</option>
	<option value="1">Option 1</option>
	<option value="2">Option 2</option>
</select>

Files Input

File Input can be easly place by declaring class to you .input-field along with .file-field.

Single File Input

If you want to style an input button with a path input we provide this structure.

File 

	<form action="#">
		<div class="file-field input-field">
			<div class="btn">
				<span>File</span>
				<input type="file">
			</div>
			<div class="file-path-wrapper">
				<input class="file-path validate" type="text">
			</div>
		</div>
	</form>
Multiple File Input

You can also use the multiple attribute to allow multiple file uploads.

File 

	<form action="#">
		<div class="file-field input-field">
			<div class="btn">
				<span>File</span>
				<input type="file" multiple>
			</div>
			<div class="file-path-wrapper">
				<input class="file-path validate" type="text" placeholder="Upload one or more files">
			</div>
		</div>
	</form>

Form Helper

Form helper will make the development easy. Simply use the specific classes and your textual inputs are customized.

Input Aligment

You can easily set input alignment with the class .left-align , .center-align and .right-align


<div class="input-field col s12 m4">
	<input type="text" id="input-left" placeholder="Input Left aligned" class="validate left-align"/>
	<label for="input-left">Input left</label>
</div>
<div class="input-field col s12 m4">
	<input type="text" id="input-center" placeholder="Input Left aligned" class="validate center-align"/>
	<label for="input-center">Input center</label>
</div>
<div class="input-field col s12 m4">
	<input type="text" id="input-right" placeholder="Input Left aligned" class="validate right-align"/>
	<label for="input-right">Input right</label>
</div>
Inline Helper

With inline-helper, you can set the your text and input in two columns.


<div class="row">
	<div class="input-field col s8">
		<input type="text" id="inline-text" placeholder="Inline text" class="validate"/>
		<label for="inline-text">Inline text</label>
	</div>
	<div class="input-field col s4">
		<input type="text" value="This is static text." readonly="readonly" class="static-text"/>
	</div>
</div>
<div class="row">
	<div class="input-field col s8">
		<input type="text" id="inline-label" placeholder="Inline text" class="validate"/>
		<label for="inline-label">Inline Label</label>
	</div>
	<div class="input-field col s4">
		<label for="label-label">Inline Label text</label>
	</div>
</div>
Text Transformation

Customize your text-field with .capitalize-text for capitalized text as input. Use lowercase-text for lowercasr as input. Use uppercase-text for uppercase as input. Use small-caps-text for small-caps text.


<div class="row">
	<div class="input-field col s12">
		<input type="text" id="capitalized-text" placeholder="Capitalized text" class="validate capitalize-text"/>
		<label for="capitalized-text">Capitalized</label>
	</div>
</div>
<div class="row">
	<div class="input-field col s12">
		<input type="text" id="lowercase-text" placeholder="Lowercase text" class="validate lowercase-text"/>
		<label for="lowercase-text">Lowercase</label>
	</div>
</div>
<div class="row">
	<div class="input-field col s12">
		<input type="text" id="uppercase-text" placeholder="Uppercase text" class="validate uppercase-text"/>
		<label for="uppercase-text">Uppercase</label>
	</div>
</div>
<div class="row">
	<div class="input-field col s12">
		<input type="text" id="samll-caps-text" placeholder="Small Caps text" class="validate small-caps-text"/>
		<label for="samll-caps-text">Small Caps Text</label>
	</div>
</div>
Input Field Options

We are pretty much familier with basic input formate of Materialize CSS. Let do some customization with input by setting .rounded-input for rounded corner for text-input, .box-input for box kind of view for text-input.

Use .input-field.informatic-input for informatic input-fields which has span as element to satisfy some text content. This can be used to provide information, warning or error.

This is informatic input field. Use .input-field.informatic-input for informatic input-fields 

<div class="row">
	<div class="input-field col s12">
		<input type="text" id="rounded-input" placeholder="Rounded input" class="validate rounded-input"/>
		<label for="rounded-input">Rounded Input</label>
	</div>
</div>
<div class="row">
	<div class="input-field col s12">
		<input type="text" id="box-input" placeholder="Boxed input" class="validate box-input"/>
		<label for="box-input">Boxed Input</label>
	</div>
</div>
<div class="row">
	<div class="input-field col s12 m4 l4">
		<input type="text" id="box-input1" placeholder="" class="validate box-input"/>
		<label for="box-input1">.col.s12.m4.l4</label>
	</div>
	<div class="input-field col s12 m6 l6">
		<input type="text" id="box-input2" placeholder="" class="validate box-input"/>
		<label for="box-input2">.col.s12.m6.l6</label>
	</div>
	<div class="input-field col s12 m2 l2">
		<input type="text" id="box-input3" placeholder="" class="validate box-input"/>
		<label for="box-input3">.col.s12.m2.l2</label>
	</div>
</div>
<div class="row">
	<div class="input-field informatic-input col s12">
		<input type="text" id="informatic-input" placeholder="Informatic Input" class="validate box-input"/><span class="input-info inline-block">This is informatic input field. Use <code class="language-markup">.input-field.informatic-input</code> for informatic input-fields</span>
		<label for="informatic-input">informatic-input</label>
	</div>
</div>
Input Color Options

Setting up the text color of input is very easy. Just set color name of your choise and prepend with -text.

Example: .blue-text, .red-text, .green-text,so on... Moreover you can also change darkness or lighness of the text via classes .text-lighten-2 and .text-darken-2 just like we did for background-color.

However materialize has fantastic UI for input, but we can have several modificaion with .box-input and .rounded-input. Let's change the border of such inputs with border-cyan. We have defined basic class for it.

Here is the list of classes for border : .border-blue .border-red .border-yellow .border-green .border-cyan .border-teal .border-amber .border-orange

Input Type Options

Manage you input content by types.

Use type="text"
Use type="email"
Use type="password"
Use type="number"
Use type="url"
